comment: Professor Ancalle-Reyes is an amazing professor. He knows his material well and is good at teaching. He will also make you participate in class at some point. He strives to get to know the name of each one of his students. Although at first he might seem intimidating, take his class. Toward the end, he provides more extra credit.

Great professor. He is also extremely arrogant, but that never bothered me. I took him for Statics and Fluids Lab. He is very knowledgeable about the subject matter he teaches and makes it enjoyable. He will grade your lab reports harshly though. I would take again for sure, I recommend him to anyone taking Fluids.

David is a great professor. He is super friendly with students, a fair grader, hilarious, and loves teaching. I took this class over the summer and it was a lab due every week (8 labs), but we only came in twice and collected the data for all the labs. He touches up a bit on the lecture before we do the labs. Super helpful, take his class!

Had him for Fluids Lab over the summer. We did all of the experiments in two class meeting times, so the rest of semester was just getting with our group and doing the lab report. He really just wanted the reports to be written well, and didn't care much if the calculations were wrong. He gives feedback on every report, do the changes and get 100.

Honestly, David's personality is a bit hard to understand, but he is a great professor. He explains material clearly, and his exams are on the foundational things, so they are not tricky and are usually simple! He gives opportunity for extra credit. Introverts beware, he can be blunt and calls on you without warning.

When you first join the class the professor seems a little scary but as time goes on you can tell that he really cares about your education and you learning the material he presents. His lectures are amazing and he is a really funny guy! Learned a lot from his class and would take him again if I could.

Intimidating at first, but he actually wants you to succeed. I feel like I've actually learned more in this class than most others I've taken in 3 years. He will try to make it hard/scary at first to weed people out, but stick around! No tests, only quizzes that are fairly easy.

Take another lab if you can. Professor Reyes will make you write out a full group lab report, whereas others will let you off with just submitting data. However, he grades mostly on formatting rather than content. As long as you make a coherent report, you'll get an A in the class. Nice and funny dude though! Great at explaining things.

He may seem scary at first, but he's an amazing lecturer and funny dude! HW and quizzes are pretty simple, but group problems will kill you. Don't worry about those grades, bc he won't consider them. As long as you do good on HW and quizzes, and show you work hard, you'll get an A. No tests in this class, just one group take-home exam.

He is one of the best professors I've taken at KSU. He will make you work for your grade, but he will give you all the materials to do great. I recommend taking him for the simple fact that he cares about the students. He will try to weed out the good/bad students. Just push through and do the work and you'll do great.

His lab report requirements helped me learn how to write a proper report. However, it is SO EXTENSIVE. Do not take it with him if you have 2 or more other classes/labs at the same time. Each report took an average of 15-18 hours to complete. He will grade the 1st one really harsh but better afterwards if you have improved. Lowest lab is dropped.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Not the easiest class, but he makes it enjoyable. He will help you as much as you help yourself in the class, and it is very nice. Take him if you can because he is an amazing professor.

Fluids is by no means an easy class with that said, David is not only a great fluids professor but also an expert in the field! I have only had a few teachers I felt were as funny and as caring as professor Reyes! KSU is making a huge mistake by not letting him teach more fluids' classes. 10/10 would recommend, but remember fluids is not easy!

Hes a great professor and explains the material very well, but it feels like the homework he assigns is a step up from whats taught in class. Also with COVID hes been experimenting with different types of exams, so its been a mixed bag of simplicity and complexity. I would recommend him when COVID doesnt affect classes as much.

David Ancalle-Reyes is definitely one of the best professors i have ever been privileged enough to work with. He is not a professor that will coddle you but he is more than happy to work with students that are willing to put in the work to do well in his class. You make not make an A but you will come out of his class a better engineer.

If youre the type of student that needs time to think and work through answers on your test, this is not the professor for you. By his own gloating and gleeful admission, he structures tests to be very difficult in order to weed out the bad ones. This instructor deliberately sabotages students to reduce his own work load. Avoid at ALL costs.
Horrible.
He does not really care about students. He takes weeks to answer the questions if you ask him to explain something. Not with Young prof!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is one of the best professors at KSU, definitely the best Fluids professor. He cares about your education and that's it. Very engaging lectures where he makes sure you understand the topics. Ask questions, try to answer things, and do your homework. Not an easy class, but you will learn A LOT. Very entertaining.
He is very laid back and encourages in class discussion. If you understand the homework, the exams shouldn't be an issue.

The class is very tough, it's one of those "earn your grade" classes. He also explains the material very well. Lectures are very engaging. Very accessible outside of class, if you e-mail him at reasonable hours he will respond almost immediately. One of my favorite classes and professors so far.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Prof. Ancalle-Reyes is a fantastic professor if you want to actually understand the material you are learning. It won't be a free A, but you will actually be able to understand what you're covering in class. If you put in the work, you'll get the grade you want. If you slack, any grade you get is on you.

What an incredible professor. Best I've had at KSU. He teaches well, will go over and over until you understand, is personable and very upfront about his expectations. Gives a review the class before the test, go to it. I made A's on both tests, although hard, but definitely passable if you take good notes. He doesn't post notes, so take good ones.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Reyes is the goat, hands down. Fluids is a tough class (I might have to take it again, lol) but he only wants students to succeed. Don't be afraid to approach him about the class or life in general, because he knows what he's talking about. Top 3 professor at KSU.

I had Reyes for Fluids. Our class was the only one to not fall behind in the material and yet it never felt rushed. In addition to entertaining and informative lectures, I have never had a professor make himself so available to his students. He even used Google Hangouts to give extra help to students outside of class before the test. A must take.

Had Reyes for Fluids lecture. One of the best professors I've had in college. PARTICIPATE IN CLASS. The more you participate and ask questions, the more he likes you. The more he likes you, the more extra credit points he gives you on tests and the final grade. He explains stuff clearly but also tries to make class fun. Hard class, but good prof.

I had him for Fluids lab. He was very good at explaining some of the more complex concepts and would always respond back quickly and be there to help if there was something I didn't get. Just try to complete the lab a week before hand so you can ask questions when you come across something you get confused. Show you get the concept and you're good.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Had Professor Reyes for lab and he was great. Always covered the topics in depth and made sure the class knew what we had to do before the lab started. For his lecture I know that his test are hard, but if you show up to class , do the homework, and actually know the material they are not hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
